newsitem.title: USA: Orlando, Fla., reaches deal to buy Navy property.
newsitem.headline: Orlando, Fla., reaches deal to buy Navy property.

text.p: Orlando reached a tentative agreement with the U.S. Navy to buy the Naval Training Center for $1.2 million, the Orlando Sentinel reported Tuesday.
The agreement for the 1,100-acre base still must be approved by Navy officials and the Department of Defense.
The 30-year-old base is scheduled to close in 1999. The Navy agreed to pay the estimated $35 million cost of cleaning up underground fuel tanks and other contaminated sites.
The city will bear the cost of tearing down buildings and improving roads and utilities to prepare for development. The base is three miles from downtown Orlando and could hold up to 3,200 homes.
Under the agreement, if the city sells the property for more than $1.2 million, it would give the Navy 75 percent of the proceeds up to $10 milion or 60 percent of the proceeds above $10 million.
Separately, the Orlando City Council approved the purchase of about 700 homes at another Navy site for $1.85 million. The homes sit on the 214-acre McCoy Annex near Orlando International Airport.
The city plans to sell them to the Orlando Neighborhood Improvement Corp and CED Construction Cos which formed a partnership to renovate them for affordable housing.
